p: Three trials (n = 100) mentioned the proteinuria remission rate at the 12-month follow-up, and the results showed that the CR (OR = 12.89, 95% CI: 1.56âˆ’106.41) of proteinuria was obviously higher in the antiviral treatment group than in the control group. Heterogeneity using the I 2 statistic with a random effect model was I 2 = 69%, P = 0.04, and the test for subgroup difference was P = 0.86 ( Fig 5).
